questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions:
a) Why is 21 February a memorable day in our national history?
b) Who is responsible to raise a storm of protest and how? Describe.
c) How did the Pakistani government try to prevent the protest?
d) What did the students of Dhaka University do against the declaration of outlạiving all sorts of public meetings and rallies?
e) How is Language Movement related to Independence Movement of Bángladesh?

sub_questions.explanation:
a. February 21 is a memorable day in our national history because on this day in 1952, the heroic son's of Bengal laid down their lives to establish Bangla as a state language of the undivided Pakistan. On this day, we pay tribute to the language martyrs because of their sacrifice for the rightful place of mother tongue.
b. The then Governor General of Pakistan, Mohammad Ali Zinnah, is responsible to raise a storm of protest. In a public meeting in Dhaka, he declared Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan, which disregarded the language rights of the Bangalee. Therefore, a mass protest started across the country.
c. The Pakistani government banned all sorts of public meetings and gatherings to stop the protest that began following Mohammad Ali Jinnah's declaration of Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan and continued non-stop.
d. Against the declaration of outlawing all sorts of public meeting and rallies, the students of Dhaka University brought out a peaceful protest procession on 21 February, defying the law.
e. The Language Movement of 1952 kindled the sparks of independence movement in East Pakistan by making the Bangalees aware of their rights. Thus, the Language Movement is related to the independence movement of Bangladesh.

questions.uddipok:
In 1912, an American Shipping Company launched a new ship called "Titanic". It was the largest and most luxurious ocean liner of the time. It weighed 52,310 tons and could carry about 3327 passengers. Experts said that nothing could make it sink. On April 10, 1912* the ship sailed on its first voyage across the Atlantic. It sailed from Southampton in England to New York in the United States with 2224 passengers of men, women and children.
On April 15, just before midnight, the ship struck a large ice-berg. The ice-berg tore a great hole in the ship's sides and the unsinkable 'Titanic' began to sink. There was a great alarm on board. Warning bells rang out. Eiveryone rushed to the lifeboats, but there was not enough room for them all: There was room for only 1178 passengers. The lifeboats took mostly women and children. It was a terrible scene.

Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: In 1912, an American Shipping Company launched the Titanic. It sailed on its maiden voyage from Southampton, England to New York, the USA. Though the ship was thought to be unsinkable, it sank colliding with a huge iceberg while crossing the Atlantic. At the time of sinking, the passengers got panicked and rushed to the lifeboats. However, the lifeboats could take only the women and the children as the number of the boats was limited.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on 'Our National Flag'.

sub_questions.explanation:
Our National Flag
The national flag of Bangladesh is a symbol of our pride, independence, and sovereignty. It is rectangular in shape and has a green background with a red circle in the center. The green color represents the vitality, youthfulness, and natural beauty of Bangladesh, while the red circle symbolizes the blood of the martyrs who sacrificed their lives for our freedom during the Liberation War of 1971. The flag reflects our struggle and victory in achieving an independent nation. It is hoisted on government buildings, schools, and during national events to inspire patriotism and unity among citizens. Our national flag reminds us of our duties toward the country and instills a sense of respect for our rich heritage and hard-earned freedom.

questions.uddipok:
Read the following story and complete it using your thought and imagination. Give a suitable title to it.
Mr. Ahmed completed his graduation. He went to Dhaka in search of a job. He applied for jobs in different offices but did not get any. So, he came back to his village and decided to be self-employed. Then, he …..

sub_questions.explanation:
Determination Brings Success
Mr. Ahmed completed his graduation. He went to Dhaka in search of a job. He applied for jobs in -different offices but did not get any. So, he came back to his village and decided to be self-employed. Then, he shared his thought with his friends, and they gave him the suggestion to start his own business. One day, one of his teachers advised him to go.to an NGO and apply for a loan. As advised, he went to an NGO of his village and applied for a loan. The NGO granted him a handsome money. With the money, he opened a restaurant in his, village. As his mother was a great cook, she initially cooked for the restaurant. The villagers used to come to his restaurant and have food, He began to earn money. Later, he hired two cooks and expanded the restaurant. Soon, he became solvent. Now, he is one of the richest men of his village. Thus, he became an example for the young men who are qualified but jobless.

questions.uddipok: The graph below show "The number of people in percentage, living below the poverty line" from 1995 to 2010. Describe the graph in 150 words. You should highlight and summarize the information given in the graph.

sub_questions.explanation: The bar chart deals with the number of people living below the poverty line in the years of 1995, 2004, 2008 and 2010. In the bar chart, the percentage of the number of people living below the poverty line is compared among four years. 35.6 percent people were living under the poverty line in 1995. Nine years later, in 2004, the number rose to 45 percent which is about 9.4 percent higher than 1995 . In 2008, fortunately the number decreased to 36.3 percent which is about 8.7 percent lower than that of four years ago. Finally, in 2010 , with a happy note the number decreased to 31.51 percent which is about 4.79 percent lower than that of 2008. So, it can be said that within the time span of 15 years the percentage of the people living below the poverty line has slightly been decreased. Though in 2008 the number rose, in the following years it decreased gradually.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Nadim/Nadia, you have a friend named Fahim/Fahima who does not read newspaper. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about the importance of reading newspaper.

sub_questions.explanation:
Nadim : Hi, Fahim? How're you?

Fahim : Fine, thanks. What're you doing?

Nadim : I'm reading a newspaper. Will you take a page?

Fahim : No, thanks. I don't read newspaper.

Nadim : What! It's really surprising!

Fahim : Why? What's the importance of reading newspaper?

Nadim : Well. Newspaper is a collection of current affairs of the world. Without reading it, you're like a frog in a dark well. Do you know what are the burning issues of our country now? Or, what's going on in our neighbouring countries?

Fahim : Really not.

Nadim : But I know, because I read newspapers regularly. Newspapers can provide you with the news of the home and abroad. It's especially important for the students as it's the best medium of enriching our general knowledge. For this, it's called the storehouse of knowledge.

Fahim : You're right.

Nadim : Newspaper can make you introduce to the culture and customs of different countries of the world. You can know some such important information which are applicable to your practical life.

Fahim : You've opened my eyes. Now, I can feel the necessity of reading newspapers. Really, I'm detached from the current world. But I promise, I'll build up the
habit of reading newspaper from today. Thank you very much.

Nadim : You're most welcome.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Noha and your friend is Mahin. Now, write a dialogue between you and yout friend about the merits and demerits of using mobile phone at teenage.

sub_questions.explanation:
Noha: Hey Mahin! I was reading an article yesterday about how mobile phones affect teenagers. It got me thinking—do you think it's more helpful or harmful?
Mahin: Hey Noha! That’s actually a great topic. I think it’s a bit of both. Mobile phones are super helpful for staying connected and accessing information, but they also have their downsides.
Noha: Totally agree. Like, one of the biggest merits is easy communication. We can call, text, or video chat with friends and family anytime.
Mahin: Yeah, and educational apps and online resources make studying easier too. We can watch tutorials, join online classes, and even do research quickly.
Noha: Right. But on the flip side, many teens get addicted to social media and games. That really affects their studies and sleep.
Mahin: Exactly. And some even suffer from anxiety or low self-esteem because of comparing themselves to others on social media.
Noha: Another issue is less face-to-face interaction. I feel like teens are losing social skills because they’re always on their phones.
Mahin: True. Plus, spending too much time staring at screens can cause eye problems and other health issues.
Noha: But still, if we use mobile phones responsibly, they can be very useful. It’s all about balance, right?
Mahin: Definitely. Using phones wisely can make teenage life easier and more productive, but overuse can lead to serious problems.
Noha: Well said, Mahin. I think every teen should know both sides before using a phone too much.
Mahin: For sure. Awareness is the first step to using technology in a healthy way

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions.

a. Why can humans neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun?

b. Describe how human beings are responsible for the increase in the greenhouse gases.

c. What do you think the main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is?

d. Why enormous areas of forests are destroyed by the people every year? Describe in brief.

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Humans can neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun, because these things are beyond their control.

(b) Human beings do some unwise activities like burning too much fossil fuels, setting up more factories, cutting down trees indiscriminately, etc. that result in the increase of greenhouse gases. Thus, they are responsible for the increase in the greenhouse gases.

(c) I think the main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is the burning of fossil fuels. With the increase of industrial activities, the combustion of coal has increased. Besides coal, mineral oil and natural gas are also burned for various purposes. Thus, every time a fossil raw material is burned, it releases carbon dioxide into the air.

(d) Enormous areas of forests are destroyed by the people every year to obtain wood and to clear regions for mining and to create pasture.
